Pre-Game Insights: Georgia’s first taste of a European Championship finals match ended in defeat but saw a 3-1 scoreline with 103 attacks and 36 shots.
Georgia fans will be pleased to hear that Willy Sagnol expects to be working for Georgia for the next few years.
Czechia’s defeat to Portugal was only their second time tasting defeat in their last 15 matches, but they have only two clean sheets in their last ten fixtures.
Georgia is more familiar with the taste of defeat (six in the last 15), but half of these have been against strong opposition, namely Spain (twice) and Morocco.
Czechia manager Ivan Hašek praised Antonín Barák and Petr Ševčík, who both came off the bench against Portugal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Saturday’s clash will mark the first-ever coming together of these two nations.
In the UK, BBC One is the channel you need to watch the game.
Within Georgia, the game will be accessible via 1TV (aka First Channel), while in Czechia, viewers can watch live via Česká Televize (CT) Sport.
